intro: Hieracium dentalatum, commonly known as the toothed hawkweed, is a flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its basal rosette of hairy, lance-shaped leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces yellow flowers arranged in a flat-topped cluster, typical of the daisy family. It is native to Europe and parts of Asia, often found in meadows and rocky soils. Hieracium dentalatum is an annual or biennial plant that thrives in temperate climates.
